did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Guide to the Marshall P. Howard papers 1890-1932.
did.physdesc: Business and personal correspondence; account books; deeds; estate settlements and maps.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract:
Papers consist of business and personal correspondence; account books; deeds; estate settlements; land and title searches with accompanying maps of areas in Tompkins, Allegheny, Broome, Cattaraugus, Schuyler and Wayne Counties. Includes material concerning the acquisition of lands for Allegheny State Park, Adirondack Park
and the Connecticut Hill Fish and Game Refuge. Game refuge files contain deeds and papers pertaining to Cornell University.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Marshall P. Howard was a Binghamton, New York attorney and title examiner for the state attorney general, ca.1900 through ca.1920.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Papers consist of business and personal correspondence; account books; deeds; estate settlements; land and title searches with accompanying maps of areas in Tompkins, Allegheny, Broome, Cattaraugus, Schuyler and Wayne Counties. Includes material concerning the acquisition of lands for Allegheny State Park, Adirondack Park and the Connecticut Hill Fish and Game Refuge. Game refuge files contain deeds and papers pertaining to Cornell University.
